Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
darling \dar"ling\, n. [OE. derling, deorling, AS. de['o]rling; de['o]re dear + -ling. See {Dear}, and {-ling}.] One dearly beloved; a favorite. [1913 Webster]
And can do naught but wail her darling's loss. --Shak. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: darling \dar"ling\, a. Dearly beloved; regarded with especial kindness and tenderness; favorite. ``Some darling science.'' --I. Watts. ``Darling sin.'' --Macaulay. [1913 Webster] ||

darling adj : dearly loved [syn: {beloved}, {dear}] n 1: a special loved one [syn: {favorite}, {favourite}, {pet}, {dearie}, {deary}, {ducky}] 2: an Australian river; tributary of the Murray River [syn: {Darling River}]
